reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was definitely not worth 150$ a night. It was basically a glamorized Motel 6. The décor looked new but was super cheap (ie.The bathtub faucet handle broke off into the tub.) There was some random abandoned building in the front of the hotel... The door to our room wouldn’t shut completely without a lot of force and we ended up sleeping with it open all night and didn’t know it until the next morning. Also, you can hear absolutely everything that is going on outside. There was nothing quiet about this place. The walls were extremely thin. We could hear every person pass by and both sides of our neighbors. I was extremely disappointed with this place and will never stay there again. I urge anyone that is thinking about booking here to go see it first.
reviews.title: More like 1 out of 3 palms

likes.disliked: — The whole experience. Not worth the money at all.

reviews.text: Couldn't have said it better myself than the last reviewer. I stayed here with my mom and at $150 a night in Scottsdale, it couldn't be beat. The beds were VERY comfortable, the rooms fashionably decorated, the service excellent. The room was TINY. My mum and I were pretty much bumping into each other but esthetically, it was very pleasing and comfortable. I will definitely stay here again...until I get rich and can afford the higher end hotels.
reviews.title: Ditto the review from March 28th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes a renovation makes all the difference but not at the 3 Palms. The interior design is worthy of any resort in Scottsdale, a very modern geometric theme with bright colors. The attitude of the women working at the front desk is also more appropriate for the massive resorts in central Scottsdale than a hotel located on the back end of the mile of cars. I really dislike attitude and disdain in my hotel staff.
reviews.title: All dressed up but still a motel

reviews.text: The renovation could not mask the original motel's structure with rooms opening up into the parking lot and the pool hanging off the side like an afterthought. The rooms are still the tight 1950s dimensions, though they appeared to vary in dimensions. One room appeared to have a hot tub two feet from the bed!
reviews.title: Shockingly good for the price

reviews.text: The location is convenient to the airport, Mesa, Tempe, Scottsdale, and the 101 interstrate but does not offer much of interest in its immediate vicinity. There is a 6 screen drive-in, waterpark and casino a few miles down the road.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a very disapointing experience with the 3 Palms hotel. I am alergic to many foods, and therefore I must prepare my own. I was told that the room that I booked over the phone had a kitchenette in it, but upon arrival I found out that my expectations would not even come close to being met. The room did not have a kitchenette in it, and the staff at the front desk were anything but helpful. I ended up leaving the hotel, very unsatisfied. I would not reccomend this hotel to anyone, based upon how rude the staff was and for the fact that it is very over priced.
reviews.title: Terrible experience at the 3 Palms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think hotels are using the term "boutique" and "resort" a little too loosely these days. The room was clean and nicely decorated, but it is a motel! The rooms are incredibly small and you can hear everything through the walls. Between the kids screaming in the room next door, and the loud music coming from the room above us at 7am, I wouldn't recommend staying at the 3 Palms Resort Oasis. What I paid for that room was highly overpriced!
reviews.title: Boutique hotel....I don't think so!

reviews.text: I stayed for a week here as a business traveler. I stayed in a regular queen room the first few nights and then a deluxe queen suite on the last night. Overall it was a less than average stay because of the unreliable internet service, which is important for me. The business center is not the most comfortable place to work in the evenings.
reviews.title: below average stay ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My reviews are as follows:
reviews.title: The Marble Motor Lodge

reviews.text: Pros-
reviews.title: WOW! We love the 3 Palms Resort Oasis!

likes.liked: — upscale luxury of the rooms and customer service

reviews.text: This hotel was super nice and easily worth twice the price. Everything was clean and very well designed. It even has a great pool and outdoor area. The hotel is also very conveniently located and easy to access from all directions.
reviews.title: 3 Palms Gets 5 Stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I arrived I was very pleasantly greeted by Amanda, who continued to provide great service throughout the duration of my stay. It's obvious that she knows her job well and enjoys the hospitality business.
reviews.title: Quick Stay

reviews.text: We found a great deal on a king room with a spa tub for one night (we were celebrating my brothers bday at midnight bingo at casino arizona, it was about 2 miles away.) The front staff was great very nice made sure we had everything we needed when we checked in. The room was very cute, not really spacious, but good enought for a nights stay. The bed was comfy but the pillows were a bit soft (for my taste.) The next morning we tried to use the spa tub, bad news, it didn't work. no spa jets. That sucked! The shower was big, but the shower head had a lot of dried residue and it was a really weak stream. Overall, it was a nice experience for 1 night and we were REALLY pleased with the price.
reviews.title: Good place for family

reviews.text: My wife and I decided t take the twins on a long summer vacation. We started in Arizona, and worked our way back up until we got back to the bay. Being on a budget, we decided to stay at local properties and stay away from bigger name hotels. The 3 palms started our trip off well. My kids loved the pool and the staff was very nice. The hotel was very affordable and the rooms were nice.
reviews.title: Amazing stay!!!

reviews.text: We cannot wait to come back. We had a great stay. Quiet(couldn't hear the neighbors or their televisions), clean "grounds", close by to many restaurants and things to do, clean pool, staff was super helpful whenever we had any questions, and the bed was super comfy. Five stars.
reviews.title: Amazing Service and Accommodations!

reviews.text: I stayed the night at this hotel last minute when I needed a cheap place to sleep. It was pretty clean and the bed was comfy. There was a coffee maker, mini-fridge, iron in the room. This is by no means a resort (even though there is a pool). But served as a great place to stay the night quickly.
reviews.title: A nice place to sleep for a cheap price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in south Scottsdale... not in the best part of Scottsdale, but not the slums either. This place is a great bargain for the price!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: It is walking distance from a restaurant, and there is a grocery store within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Summer rates

reviews.text: The 3 Palms is a very clean and friendly hotel. All staff that we encountered (front desk, maid service, maintenance) were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a standard 2 queen room, there was more than enough room and the beds were great! Air conditioning was awesome and loved the pool and hot tub area. The guest lounge is great for when you want to use the computer to print out directions to somewhere. This is our second time staying at 3 Palms and we will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price

reviews.text: Finished up a month-long stay and overall a satisfying stay. This is like your poor man's Scottsdale resort, so you will find alot of families and others who aren't in the top economic class and can't afford the top Scottsdale resorts. The prices here in summer average about $45 a night. Most rooms contain a small frig and 90's era microwave. The TV's are all top notch and a good DVD player is also included. Beds are very cozy and this place is probably most like a good Hampton Inn in terms of quality. There is a park across the street, but it also doubles as a frisbee course and dog owners rarely pick up after their pets. Free coffee in in AM in the lounge, but most times the machine would be out when I got inside. Friendly, front desk staff, but check your credit cards because I had major snafu that took 2 hours to fix.
reviews.title: Best deal hands down!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I took a last minute trip to Scottsdale this past weekend and loved the trip, but were not all that impressed with the 3 Palms. It is more of a "motel" than a "Hotel". You access your room from the outside, such as in a Holiday Inn. The rooms have been updated and they do offer good amenities such as a refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, etc. The price was good too. It is just not as advertised.
reviews.title: Okay - Not Great

likes.liked: — I liked the price and the room amenities
likes.disliked: — The orange everywhere and the access to the room from the outside

reviews.title: A great little Gem, a small resort with a personal touch
reviews.text: Basically - clean, reasonably priced room, but nothing to write home about.

reviews.title: Don't pay more than $75...
reviews.text: Being a frequent traveler to Arizona I found this wonderful little hotel in the heart of Scottsdale. The hotel is very hip and retro, clean rooms and centrally located and close to shopping, restaurants and the interstate. I found the staff to be wonderful, very friendly; they make you feel like you are at a 5 star hotel… I enjoyed the pool area and you can receive a great massage on site… A great value~

Very nice pool and brand new fitness area. Room was remodeled, but awkward. Example, unable to view TV from anywhere besides the bed, and had to close cabinet doors covering TV to walk from bathroom to couch or front door. Found the refrigerator and DVD player in the same cabinet under the TV, same issue with the cabinet doors. Bed was comfy. Staff were friendly and upbeat. Surrounding area was very pleasant. Not a resort, but definitely not a dump either.
reviews.title: No complains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty impressive lobby, all white, minimalist (as rest of the premises), mostly clean. Young and dynamic frontdesk personnel. Inn converted to a motel, not a hotel definitely. Yet, pretty impressive and stylish. Rooms are very nicely decorated, beds are very very comfy with down pillows and comforters. Bath and restroom are together in one very tiny room, walls of which was completly covered with black marble, looks luxurious yet makes you feel a little trapped. Nice hot water supply. Pretty pool area. There is a bar at the pool, however, was closed due to incomplete renovation. B/c of the same reason, there was no room service, no breakfast. Locationwise, a little awkward. Yes, it is close to Scottsdale (compared to Pheonix!) but it is on a street lined with auto dealers. But it is right next to a recreational area where you see people strolling and biking around an artificical pool. After seeing downtown Scottsdale and the hotels on the Scottsdale Drive, I regretted staying in this hotel. Even the Double Tree there is very attractive. So explore your options in that area first. We paid an average of $150 per night.
reviews.title: A Nice Coat of Paint

reviews.text: 16 SEPT 2013
reviews.title: Affordable, great location, no resort fee, mini frig and micro!

reviews.text: This resort property (a hotel remodeled) is designated as a resort because of the spa.
reviews.title: short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (Resort defined: A hotel may consist of guest rooms, restaurants, a pool, meeting space and business services. A resort, by most standards, may include all the above, but must also include an associated recreational aspect, be it golf, spa, amusement park, skiing, etc.)
reviews.title: Needs a little TLC

reviews.text: The property is affordable, is in a great location between Snottsdale (correct spelling to denote the pretentious and and less than genuine attitude) Tempe. This property was remodeled and painted which adds to the aesthetics.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Very helpful. Great Rooms/Low Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is very quiet at night. The pool closes and is locked at 12am.
reviews.title: Perfect for good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pictures on the website are pretty misleading. Upon arriving, the tiny lobby was the only part that looked like the pictures. Keep in mind that this place is essentially a motel, on par with a Motel 8 if it weren't for the decor in some places. It really wasn't that terrible of a stay, but I must draw attention to details that were lacking because boutique hotels are supposed to specialize in said details and special touches.
reviews.title: Motel, not Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's barely located in Scottsdale, and not the part that most envision, though it isn't in a necessarily terrible area. Half of the rooms are right on a street, separated only by a sidewalk, a strip of grass and the curb. Coming here with my significant other I had envisioned a hotel at least comparable to the Clarendon in Phoenix, but it looked more like a Best Western from the outside. The room itself was possibly as small as you can get. We had paid for a room with a king bed and a jacuzzi, but never used the jacuzzi. This is because the carpet surrounding the jacuzzi was soaking wet when we arrived and stayed that way the entire time. It wasn't that pleasant having to sleep inches away from this leaky jacuzzi, but the bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: a desert OASIS, indeed!

likes.liked: — the bed was the best i have EVER slept in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The TV would flicker on and off, seemingly to a pattern, and we figured out the culprit: the people staying above us were playing music on their stereo and the TV went in and out to the beat. Classy, so we left and came back later that night. We fell asleep and at about 2 A.M., we heard very loud arguing, drunken laughing and crying, and finally a screaming match between two high school or college age girls and a guy. I'm a really heavy sleeper, but the walls are so thin that you can hear a lot. It got to the point where I heard their whole dilemma and wanted to scream "GIVE HER HER MONEY BACK!" so it would be over with. Keep in mind these people were not directly above us, but above us and to the right one room. We still heard them. I called the front desk and they said they'd come, but we still heard them fighting an hour later. Not wanting to ruin a supposed weekend vacation, we finally fell asleep with the help of earplugs. Said guests were still there the next morning, and still fighting. Also, the guests next to us approached us in the morning to ask if we wanted to drink beer with them. They looked like convicts on the run, not young hip vacationers.
reviews.title: Will be going back!!

reviews.text: Clientele: 18-26 year olds who reserved a room here on the fly with their clubbing buddies or new "friends". Kevin Federline sans money from Britney. A few disheartened people who desired a nice place to stay but got this instead and are stuck here until they can go home.
reviews.title: Motel not Hotel

likes.liked: — The staff was friendly and really tried to be helpful with the broken a/c
likes.disliked: — Motel not hotel; Zero services and/or amenities; Weird location

reviews.text: My point is, this is not a trendy boutique hotel like it's marketed. It's Days Inn with better decor. I wouldn't pay upwards of $65 for this place.
reviews.title: Be forewarned but remain optomistic

reviews.text: 3 palms is such a nice laid back hotel. Very clean , nice rooms, and nice added touch with the blu sol spa on location. But made me enjoy my stay the most was the GREAT customer service from Amanda :-) she was helpful such a sweetheart. I will tell everyone I know to book a room at 3 palms because of how welcome Amanda made me feel. Not to mention she helped me plan my boyfriend's bday. He loved it !!! Glad it all worked out :) Thanks
reviews.title: Best Customer Service

reviews.text: Nice hotel and comfortable beds...Fabulous front desk lady Amanda was so awesome.. Great help with her directing us to sites like the beautiful aquarium and wonderful shopping centers. She is super and a true gem of an employee for this or any hotel..
reviews.title: Cozy and very clean

reviews.text: If you're on a budget and need to be in or around Scottsdale, this is a great hotel. My family and I were surprised by the down pillows, higher thread count, and granite counter tops. The second best thing was the cleanliness of the room. Couch in the other room may have been a little overbearing for its size, but overall we were very satisfied with our stay.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price + helpful customer service

reviews.text: The best thing was the customer service - everyone at the front desk was very accommodating. They even help you book your tours, so if you're coming from out of state, this is a great help. Emmanuel deserves major kudos for assisting me with the booking of both the hotel and our Grand Canyon tour, city tour, and hot air balloon ride. Brian was also helpful in hooking us up with a good discount.
reviews.title: Very good stay

reviews.text: The room was very clean and beds were soft and nice. I met a employe named Luna that was very friendly and helpful. AC worked great in August and kept the room super chilled. I would recommend to others to book this hotel. Especially because of the service I got from Luna. Service goes a long way and always gets my return business if its good.
reviews.title: So pleased with my experience!
